title: [Large-Scale] Collaborative Instructional Design in Higher Education Science Education: CMM-Based Teacher-Designer Collaboration Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge (experiment design, variable control), understanding of curriculum design principles and the scientific inquiry process
context.additional_context: Collaboration between science instructional designers and professors to develop effective experiment/observation-centered curricula. Conducts offline lab classes in BYOD environments, progressing toward summative assessments (lab reports, data analysis results).

learning_goals: Learners will explain the four core stages of the Collaborative Mapping Model (CMM: Observation–Hypothesis–Experiment–Analysis) and apply them to science curriculum design case studies.

Learners will propose at least three strategies for building trust-based relationships between instructional designers and instructors, such as collaborative hypothesis development, variable control collaboration, and evidence-based feedback.
When designing science curricula, learners will suggest methods to strengthen instructor-student interactions (e.g., collaborative experiment design, data analysis discussions) using the CMM.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
